author: Mike Kelly
title: The Tories aren't the new Nazis and why it was wrong to call them that
text:
The Tories aren't the new Nazis and why it was wrong to call them that 13:00, 22 Oct 2016 The description diminishes those who suffered at the hands of the real Nazis, argues columnist Mike Kelly Share Get daily news by email PA Wire Conservative MP Nigel Adams 
A Look North presenter has been suspended after calling the Tories the ‘new Nazi party’. 
Like many of us, Danny Carpenter had been outraged by what we see as the right wing lurch of the Tory party as it seeks to hoover up UKIP supporters in a post Brexit manoeuvre. 
It has had to rein in some of its ideas like that aired by Home Secretary Amber Rudd to ‘name and shame’ companies into revealing how many foreign workers they employed. 
And I believe it was after this that Mr Carpenter, on his personal Facebook account and not his professional BBC one, wrote the following: 
“Now let’s see the Labour Party grow some proper balls and unite in the lobbies to vote out every cynical, vicious, racist and xenophobic piece of legislation these new Nazis propose”. 
It was all too much for Tory MP Nigel Adams. Gareth Fuller/PA Wire A view of he jungle migrant camp in Calais, France 
“Neutrality is so important but when you read such anti-Tory rhetoric from a well known local reporter, it does nothing to heal the preconceptions about BBC bias that many in politics have,” he raged or fumed or whatever. 
Nige’s comments I saw were quoted in the last bastion of news objectivity and neutrality The Sun. 
About the same time it was passing judgement on Mr Carpenter’s personal opinion, the Sun on its news pages published a story based on a facial recognition app it said revealed child immigrants to be around 100 years old. 
Some members of the public put the same app to the test themselves and came up with altogether different results. 
One, a man in his 20s, used it on himself only for the app to decide he was in his 50s. Someone tried it on a pic of a 17-year-old Wayne Rooney which said he was 27. 
By chance, and also last week, it was decided that Sun columnist Kelvin Mackenzie was OK to express his moral outrage at Channel 4 for having a Muslim member of staff wearing a hijab front the news on the day of the Nice lorry attack. 
Apparently it’s to do with freedom of speech - which allows you to insult people. Insult a certain type of person, it seems. 
For my part I did think calling the Tories the ‘new Nazis’ was wrong, not because of the sensibilities of Enoch Rudd and her ilk, but out of respect for the million of Jews, Soviet POWs, ethnic Poles, Serbs, Roma, the Disabled, Freemasons, Slavs, Homosexuals, Jehovah’s Witnesses and Spanish Republicans who died in the Holocaust. 
You completely lose perspective on their suffering by using the ‘Nazi’ tag in this context. 
However, with all the right wing anti-immigrant bile passing as news content these days, perhaps it is time to re-visit that dark moment in history to remind ourselves of how and why it happened in the first place.
